thread.title: MUSIC: Eric Church, Carrie Underwood, Luke Bryan top 2016 Stagecoach Festival lineup
thread.title_full: MUSIC: Eric Church, Carrie Underwood, Luke Bryan top 2016 Stagecoach Festival lineup - Press Enterprise

author: VANESSA FRANKO
title: MUSIC: Eric Church, Carrie Underwood, Luke Bryan top 2016 Stagecoach Festival lineup
text:
BY VANESSA FRANKO / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 5, 2015 Updated: 11:58 a.m. Eric Church, Carrie Underwood and Luke Bryan will headline the 2016 Stagecoach Country Music Festival, festival organizers announced Monday.
The 10th anniversary of the popular event will take place April 29-May 1 at the Empire Polo Club in Indio.
Other artists on the lineup include The Band Perry, John Fogerty, Chris Young, Emmylou Harris and more.
All three of the headliners have topped the bill in the past. Church was an emerging artist in 2007 and played an afternoon set on the Mane Stage before returning to headline in 2014. Underwood was the penultimate act in 2008 and then topped the bill in 2011. Bryan, like Church, started as an emerging artist with an early time slot in 2008 before moving up to a later afternoon set in 2012 and he finally headlined in 2014.
Church will headline Friday, April 29. Also performing that day are Young, Harris, Sam Hunt, Eric Paslay, Marty Stuart, Robert Earl Keen, Jana Kramer, Lucero, Kristian Bush, Billy Joe Shaver, Whitey Morgan, Dale Watson, Drake White and the Big Fire, The Malpass Brothers, Cody Jinks, Carl Anderson, Tigerman Woah!, Haley Georgia and Leroy Powell.
PHOTOS: Stagecoach Country Music Festival through the years
Underwood will top the bill on Saturday, April 30. Before she closes out the night, The Band Perry, Dustin Lynch, Fogerty, Chris Stapleton, Lee Ann Womack, Sam Palladio, Rodney Crowell, Langhorne Slim and the Law, Pokey LaFarge, Mo Pitney, Sam Outlaw, Madisen Ward and the Mama Bear, Jamestown Revival, Waddie Mitchell, Rainey Qualley, Caitlyn Smith, Luke Bell, Aaron Watson, These Wild Plains and Susto will perform.
Bryan will close the festival on Sunday, May 1. Little Big Town, Joe Nichols, The Doobie Brothers, A Thousand Horses, RaeLynn, The Turnpike Troubadours, Old Dominion, Jerry Douglas presents the Earls of Leicester, The Marshall Tucker Band, Jason Boland and the Stragglers, Amanda Shires, The Deslondes, Johnny Lee, Midland, EmiSunshine, Ruthie Collins, William Elliott Whitmore and ChessBoxer will also perform.
Tickets are $299 for general admission, a $30 increase from the summer pre-sale, with the Corral Standing Pit and Corral Reserved Seating coming in at $899 per person. Kids 10 and younger get into the festivalâ€™s general admission areas for free.
In June, promoter Goldenvoice sold some passes in an advance sale, similar to Coachella, which will hold its twin editions April 15-17 and April 22-24, the two weekends before Stagecoach.
The remaining tickets will go on sale at 11 a.m. pacific on Friday, Oct. 9.
For those who want the RV experience, you must fill out an application by 10 a.m. Friday to get a spot on the waiting list. Camping is $550-$950.
The festival has grown from being the country cousin to the massively popular Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival into an event that has spawned imitators around the U.S. Stagecoach has struck gold as a tastemaker in the country arena, snagging the likes of Church, Taylor Swift, Miranda Lambert, Jason Aldean and Florida Georgia Line long before they were household names.
STAGECOACH 2015: 10 things we'll remember about the festival
In addition to the Mane Stage, which features the biggest names in contemporary country, Stagecoach also has a rich history of supporting bluegrass and alt-country on its other stages. In recent years, Stagecoach has also brought more classic rock into the fold, with artists such as ZZ Top, Lynyrd Skynyrd and George Thorogood attracting throngs of fans to the airplane hangar-sized Palomino Stage. This year, John Fogerty, The Doobie Brothers and the Marshall Tucker Band fill the classic rock niche.
Visit stagecoachfestival.com for passes and more information.
Contact the writer: vfranko@pe.com or @vanessafranko on Twitter
